docs.summary: Sliders allow users to select a number from a given range.

srcDocs.summary: Sliders allow users to select a number from a given range.

docs.summary: Sets or gets the slider's maximum value.

srcDocs.summary: Sets or gets the slider's maximum value.

docs.summary: Sets or gets the slider's minimum value.

srcDocs.summary: Sets or gets the slider's minimum value.

docs.summary: Sets or gets a slider's step value.
description: The `step` property along with the [`stepType`](#stepType) determes the
size of each slider step and how many step units the slider is divided into.

srcDocs.summary: Sets or gets a slider's step value.
description: The `step` property along with the [`stepType`](#stepType) determes the
size of each slider step and how many step units the slider is divided into.

docs.summary: Sets or gets a slider's step type.
description: The `stepType` determines how the slider's steps work:
The step type can be:
+ `"value"` - Each step's size is the number of units defined by the
[`step`](#step) property's value. For example, suppose a slider has a
[`min`](#min) value of `0`, [`max`](#max) value of `10`, and
[`step`](#step) value of `5`. Each step's size will be 5 units, meaning
there will be 2 steps.
+ `"count"` - The number of steps is determined by number the units
in the [`step`](#step) property's value. For example, suppose a slider
has a [`min`](#min) value of `0`, [`max`](#max) value of `10`, and
[`step`](#step) value of `5`. There will be 5 steps, meaning each step
will be 2 units.

srcDocs.summary: Sets or gets a slider's step type.

The step type can be:
+ `"value"` - Each step's size is the number of units defined by the

[`min`](#min) value of `0`, [`max`](#max) value of `10`, and
[`step`](#step) value of `5`. Each step's size will be 5 units, meaning
there will be 2 steps.
+ `"count"` - The number of steps is determined by number the units
in the [`step`](#step) property's value. For example, suppose a slider
has a [`min`](#min) value of `0`, [`max`](#max) value of `10`, and
[`step`](#step) value of `5`. There will be 5 steps, meaning each step
will be 2 units.
